newsitem.title: USA: Data Research says Q1 net up on fees.
newsitem.headline: Data Research says Q1 net up on fees.

text.p: Data Research Associates Inc said Thursday a 28-percent increase in net income and six-percent gain in revenues in the first quarter was driven by a sharp increase in service fees.
The company reported net income of $541,000 in the period, compared to $420,000 one year ago. Revenues totaled $7.1 million, versus $6.7 million in the first quarter of 1995.

"This increase (in service fees) was caused in large part by incremental maintenance fees resulting from new software sales," said Mike Mellinger, Data Research's president and chief executive officer.
Data Research develops information services software.
